title: Cork (city)
summary: Cork (/kɔːrk/; Irish: Corcaigh [ˈkɔɾˠkɪɟ], from corcach, meaning "marsh")[6] is the second largest city in the Republic of Ireland, located in the south-west of Ireland, in the province of Munster. Following an extension to the city's boundary in 2019, its population is c. 210,000.[3]
